data.title: List of works by Franz Danzi
data.text:
This list is manually maintained, therefore some of the available pieces may not yet be linked from this page. For an automatically generated alphabetical list of all available pieces, please see

Category:Danzi, Franz.

A list of works in the composer category that are not included here can be found .

Please consult the manual of style for creating composer work lists.

Contents

1 List of works, by Pechstaedt numbers

1.1 P. 1—46 - Stage Works

1.2 P. 47—162 - Sacred Works

1.3 P. 163—217 - Secular Vocal Works

1.4 P. 218—296 - Instrumental Works

1.5 P. 297—310 - Arrangements

1.6 P. 311—346 - Works of uncertain authorship

2 List of works, by Opus numbers

3 Other works

List of works, by Pechstaedt numbers

P. 1—46 - Stage Works

P. 1 - Cleopatra, duodrama in 1 act (text : Johann Leopold Neumann); 1st performance : Mannheim, Hoftheater, 30 January 1780.

P. 2 - Azakia, singspiel in 3 acts (text : Christian Friedrich Schwan); 1st performance : Mannheim, Hoftheater, 6 June 1780. Lost.

P. 3 - Der Sylphe, singspiel in 1 act (text : Friedrich Ludwig Wilhelm Meyer); 1st performance : Mannheim, Hoftheater, 1788. Lost.

P. 4 - Der Triumph der Treue, singspiel in 3 acts (text : Johann Friedrich Binder von Krieglstein); 1st performance : Munich, Hoftheater, February 1789. Lost.

P. 5 - Der Quasimann, comic oper in 2 acts (text : Matthias Georg Lambrecht); 1st performance : Munich, Hoftheater, August 1789. Only 1 aria extant.

P. 6 - Die Mitternachtsstunde, comic oper in 3 acts (text : Matthias Georg Lambrecht); 1st performance : Munich, Hoftheater, April 1798.

P. 7 - Der Kuß, tragicomic opera in 3 acts (text : Matthias Georg Lambrecht); 1st performance : Munich, Hoftheater, 27 June 1799.

P. 8 - El Bondocani, singspiel in 1 act (text : Matthias Georg Lambrecht); 1st performance : Munich, Hoftheater, 20 August 1802.

P. 9 - Iphigenie in Aulis, opera-seria in 3 acts (text : Karl Reger); 1st performance : Munich, Hoftheater, 27 January 1807. Only 2 arias and 2 marches extant.

P. 10 - Deucalion et Pirrha, opera in 1 act (text : Jean-Jacques d’Hogguer from German by François Poullain de Saint-Foix); 1st performance unknown c.1810.

P. 11 - Dido, melodrama in 1 act (text : Georg Reinbeck); 1st performance : Stuttgart, Hoftheater, 18 December 1811.

P. 12 - Camilla und Eugen oder Der Gartenschlüssel, singspiel in 1 act (text : Franz Karl Hiemer); 1st performance : Stuttgart, Hoftheater, 15 March 1812.

P. 13 - Der Berggeist oder Schicksal und Treue, romantic opera in 2 acts (text : Karl Philipp von Lohbauer); 1st performance : Karlsruhe, Hoftheater, 19 April 1813.

P. 14 - Malvina, singspiel in 3 acts (text : Georg Christian Römer); 1st performance : Karlsruhe, Hoftheater, 26 December 1814. Music destroyed in 1942.

P. 15 - Turandot, singspiel in 2 acts (text : Carlo Gozzi); 1st performance : Karlsruhe, Hoftheater, 26 December 1816.

P. 16 - L'Abbé de l'Attaignant oder Die Theaterprobe, singspiel in 1 act; Karlsruhe, Hoftheater, 14 September 1820.

P. 17 - Music for Cimarosa's Gli Orazi e i Curiazi for the Munich performance in 1806.

P. 18 - Recitative and Aria for Generali's Die Bacchanten; 1st performance : Karlsruhe, 10 January 1819. Music destroyed in 1942.

P. 19 - Der Tod des Orpheus, ballet in 4 acts; 1st performance : Munich, 10 October 1784. Lost.

P. 20 - Der Teufel in allen Ecken, ballet in 1 act; 1st performance : Munich, 28 January 1785. Lost.

P. 21 - L'Enlèvement de Proserpine, ballet; 1st performance unknown. Music lost but for the arrangements for piano 4 hands in 'Délassement musical' No. 3—7.

P. 22 - Die Zauberhöhle oder Arlequins Triumph, pantomime in 2 acts; 1st performance : Karlsruhe, 6 June 1819. Music destroyed in 1942.

P. 23 - Music for Schletter's play Die Wiederkauf (songs and duets); most likely performed in Munich in 1780. Lost.

P. 24 - Music for Brandes' play Der Schriffbruch (overture, marches and entr'actes); 1st performance : Mannheim, 4 March 1781.

P. 25 - Music for Iffland's play Albert von Thurneisen oder Liebe und Pflicht im Streit (overture and entr'actes); 1st performance : Mannheim, 28 May 1781.

P. 26 - Music for d'Arien's play Laura Rosetti (songs); 1st performance : Mannheim, 15 August 1781.

P. 27 - Music for Schiller's play Die Räuber (entr'acte); 1st performance : Mannheim, 13 January 1782.

P. 28 - Music for Plümecke's play Lanassa (choruses); 1st performance : Mannheim, 29 December 1782.

P. 29 - Music for Gotter's play Der Liebhaber ohne Namen (overture, entr'actes and choruses); 1st performance : Mannheim, 20 January 1783.

P. 30 - Music for von Klein's play Franz von Sickingen (entr'actes); 1st performance : Mannheim, 27 February 1783.

P. 31 - Music for Iffland's Liebe um Liebe (?); 1st performance : Mannheim, 20 November 1785.

P. 32 - Overture in E♭ major to von Babo's play Die Strelitzen; 1st performance : Munich, April 1789.

P. 33 - March for Maier's play Der Sturm von Boxberg; 1st performance : Mannheim, 19 April 1781. Music destroyed in 1942.

P. 34 - March in D major for Törring-Guttenzell's play Agnes Bernauerin; 1st performance : Mannheim, 6 January 1781.

P. 35 - Two pieces for Kotzebue's play Die Hussiten vor Naumburg (chorus and entr'acte); 1st performance : Leipzig, September 1802.

P. 36 - Music for Schiller's play Wilhelm Tell (overture, songs and marches); 1st performance : Munich, 11 September 1806.

P. 37 - Music for Klingemann's play Columbus (overture, choruses and marches); 1st performance : Stuttgart, 21 July 1809.

P. 38 - Wedding March in G major for the play Medea (author unknown); 1st performance unknown. Only its arrangement for piano 4 hands survived in 'Délassement musical' No. 8.

P. 39 - Music for Robert's play Die Tochter Jephtas (march and choruses); dated 1812. Music destroyed in 1942.

P. 40 - Music for Kotzebue's play Mädchenfreundschaft (ballet and aria); dated c.1815. Music destroyed in 1942.

P. 41 - Music for Klingemann's play Faust (?); 1st performance : Karlsruhe, 21 March 1817. Music destroyed in 1942.

P. 42 - Chorus for von Auffenberg's play Die Spartaner; 1st performance : Karlsruhe, 7 March 1819. Music destroyed in 1942.

P. 43 - Entr'acte in E♭ major for Töpfer's play Der Tagesbefehl; dated 1820. Music destroyed in 1942.

P. 44 - Music for von Auffenberg's play Die Flibustier (song and march); 1st performance : Karlsruhe, 13 June 1820. Music destroyed in 1942.

P. 45 - Music for Shakespeare's play Romeo und Julia (menuetto and allegretto for winds); dated c.1822. Music destroyed in 1942.

P. 46 - Music for von Auffenberg's play Viola (overture, entr'actes, march and song); 1st performance : Karlsruhe, 31 August 1823.

P. 47—162 - Sacred Works

P. 47 - Abraham auf Moria, oratorio in 2 parts; 1st performance : Stuttgart, 1 January 1808.

P. 48 - Preiss Gottes (Danket dem Herrn), cantata; dated 1803.

P. 49 - Psalm 6, Op. 60 for soli (SATB), choir (SATB) & organ; dated 1803.

P. 50 - Psalm 32 in E♭ major for SATB & organ; dated c.1820.

P. 51 - Herr Gott dir loben wir!, choral in C minor.

P. 52 - Nun enden sich die schweren Leiden, choral in D minor.

P. 53 - Klagelied : Selig sind die..., choral in D major.

P. 54 - Hymne an Gott : Singt Lob dem Herrn in E♭ major, for male choir (TTBB), brass (2 horns, 3 trombones) or piano.

P. 55 - Mass in E♭ major for soli (SATB), choir (SATB) & orchestra; No. 5 in Missae completae del Sig. Francesco Danzi.

P. 56 - Mass in G minor for soli (SATB), choir (SATB) & continuo; dated 1798, No. 2 in Missae completae del Sig. Francesco Danzi.

P. 57 - Mass No. 1 in B{f{lat}} major for soli (SATB), choir (SATB) & organ (Offenbach: André), No. 3 in Missae completae del Sig. Francesco Danzi.

P. 58 - Mass No. 2 in D major for soli (SATB), choir (SATB), orchestra & organ (Offenbach: André), No. 7 in Missae completae del Sig. Francesco Danzi.

P. 59 - Mass in G major for soli (SATB), choir (SATB), 2 horns, strings & organ (München: Falter), No. 8 in Missae completae del Sig. Francesco Danzi.

P. 60 - Mass in B♭ major for SATB, orchestra & organ, No. 4 in Missae completae del Sig. Francesco Danzi.

P. 61 - Mass in C minor Missa solemnis aulica for soli (SATB), choir (SATB), orchestra & organ, No. 6 in Missae completae del Sig. Francesco Danzi.

P. 62 - Mass in D minor for SATB, orchestra & organ, No. 1 in Missae completae del Sig. Francesco Danzi.

P. 63 - Requiem in D minor for soli (SATB), chorus (SATB), orchestra & organ, dated 1810.

P. 64 - Christus factus est, gradual in F major for SATB, winds & organ.

P. 65 - De profundis, gradual in E♭ major for SATB & organ.

P. 66 - Laetatus sum, gradual in A major for SATB & continuo.

P. 67 - O salutaris hostia, gradual in E major for SATB & organ.

P. 68 - Qui sedes Domine super Cherubim, gradual in D minor for SATB a capella.

P. 69 - Ad te levavi, tract in G minor for SATB, continuo & organ.

P. 70 - Confitemini Domino, tract in E♭ major for SATB, continuo & organ.

P. 71 - Qui confidunt in Domino, tract in G minor for SATB, strings & organ.

P. 72 - Qui habitat in adjutorio, tract in E♭ major for SATB, continuo & organ.

P. 73 - Saepe expugnaverunt me, tract in D minor for SATB, continuo & organ.

P. 74 - Ave verum corpus, canticle in G minor for soprano & organ.

P. 75 - Stabat mater, canticle in G minor for SATB, 2 horns, strings & organ; 1st performance : Stuttgart, Good Friday 1808.

P. 76 - Stabat mater, canticle in C minor for SSATTB & orchestra; 1st performance : Vienna, Good Friday 1827.

P. 77 - Beati omnes qui timent Dominum, offertory in E major for SATB & orchestra.

P. 78 - Benedixisti Domine, offertory in G major for SATB, continuo & organ.

P. 79 - Bonum est confiteri, offertory in B♭ major for SATB, continuo & organ.

P. 80 - Confitebor tibi Domine, offertory in F major for SATB, continuo & organ.

P. 81 - Dextera Domini fecit, offertory in D minor for SATB & organ.

P. 82 - Introibo in domum tuam, offertory in G major for 2 tenors, orchestra & organ.

P. 83 - In te speravi Domine, offertory in B♭ major for SATB, orchestra & organ

P. 84 - Jubilate Deo omnis terra, offertory in C major for tenor solo, choir (SATB), orchestra & organ.

P. 85 - Justitiae Domini rectae, offertory in F major for soli (SATB), choir (SATB), continuo & organ.

P. 86 - Laetamini in Deo coelites, offertory in G major for SATB & orchestra.

P. 87 - Laudate Dominum, offertory in G major for SATB, strings & organ.

P. 88 - Laudate Dominum, offertory in A major for SAT, continuo & organ.

P. 89 - Laudate Dominum, offertory in B♭ major for SATB, strings & organ.

P. 90 - Levavi oculos meos, offertory in C major for soprano solo, choir (SATB), orchestra & organ.

P. 91 - Meditabor in mandatis tuis, offertory in C major for SATB, continuo & organ.

P. 92 - Non mortui laudabunt te Domine, offertory in D minor for SATB, orchestra & organ.

P. 93 - Qui timent Dominum, offertory in E♭ major for soli (ST), choir (SATB), orchestra & organ.

P. 94 - Scapulis suis obumbrabit tibi, offertory in D minor for SATB, continuo & organ.

P. 95 - Victimae paschali laudes, offertory in B♭ major for SATB, orchestra & organ.

P. 96 - Illumina faciem tuam, communio in E♭ major for SATB, continuo & organ.

P. 97 - Jerusalem quae aedificatur, communio in E major for SATB, continuo & organ.

P. 98 - Magnificat in C major for SATB, orchestra & organ.

P. 99 - Magnificat in D major for SATB, orchestra & organ.

P. 100 - Te Deum in C major for soli (SATB), choir (SATB), orchestra & organ; 1st performance : Munich, 14 January 1806.

P. 101 - Te Deum in D major for soli (SATB), choir (SATB), orchestra & organ.

P. 102 - Te Deum in E♭ major for SATB, orchestra & organ. Lost.

P. 103 - Te Deum in D major for SATB, wind sextet & organ. Lost.

P. 104 - Credo quod redemptor, responsory in F major for SATB, continuo & organ.

P. 105 - Domine quanto veneris, responsory in E minor for SATB, continuo & organ.

P. 106 - Domine secundum actum, responsory in A major for SATB, continuo & organ.

P. 107 - Hei mihi Domine, responsory in G minor for SATB, continuo & organ.

P. 108 - Libera me Domine, responsory in D minor for SATB, orchestra & organ.

P. 109 - Lumen ad revelationem, responsory in C major for SATB, continuo & organ.

P. 110 - Memento mei Deus, responsory in C major for SATB, continuo & organ.

P. 111 - Me recorderis, responsory in E minor for SATB, continuo & organ.

P. 112 - Peccantem me quotidie, responsory in D major for SATB, continuo & organ.

P. 113 - Qui Lazarum resuscitasti, responsory in G minor for SATB, continuo & organ.

P. 114 - Alma redemptoris mater antiphon in D major for SATB, orchestra & organ.

P. 115 - Ave regina coelorum, antiphon in G major for SATB & organ.

P. 116 - Regina coeli, antiphon in C major for SATB, orchestra & organ.

P. 117 - Regina coeli, antiphon in D major for soli (ST), choir (SATB), orchestra & organ.

P. 118 - Crudelis Herodes, hymn in D minor for SATB, continuo & organ.

P. 119 - Haec dies quam fecit, hymn in C major for SATB, continuo & organ.

P. 120 - O salutaris hostia in C major, hymn for bass or alto solo with organ or piano ad lib.

P. 121 - Pange lingua gloriosa, hymn in D major for SATB a capella.

P. 122 - Beatus vir, psalm in C major for SATB, orchestra & organ; 1st performance : Munich, 14 August 1823.

P. 123 - Confitebor tibi Domine, psalm in B♭ major for SATB, orchestra & organ; 1st performance : Munich, 14 August 1823.

P. 124 - Confitebor tibi Domine, psalm in E♭ major for SATB, orchestra & organ.

P. 125 - Credidi propter, psalm (115) in D minor for tenor solo, choir (SATB), strings & organ.

P. 126 - De profundis, psalm (129) in E minor for SATB, strings & organ; 1st performance : Munich, 14 August 1823.

P. 127 - Dixit Dominus, psalm (110) in C major for SATB, orchestra & organ.

P. 128 - Dixit Dominus, psalm (110) in D major for SATB, orchestra & organ.

P. 129 - Domine probasti me, psalm (138) in D minor for SATB, strings & organ.

P. 130 - In convertendo Dominus, psalm (125) in F major for SATB, strings & organ; 1st performance : Munich, 14 August 1823.

P. 131 - In exitu Israel, psalm in E♭ major for SATB, strings & organ; 1st performance : Munich, 14 August 1823.

P. 132 - Laetatus sum, psalm in A major for SATB, strings & organ; 1st performance : Munich, 14 August 1823.

P. 133 - Lauda Jerusalem, psalm in G major for SATB, strings & organ; 1st performance : Munich, 14 August 1823.

P. 134 - Laudate Dominum, psalm (117) in D major for SATB, strings & organ; 1st performance : Munich, 14 August 1823.

P. 135 - Laudate pueri, psalm (113) in F major for SATB, strings & organ; 1st performance : Munich, 14 August 1823.

P. 136 - Memento Domine David, psalm in E♭ major for SATB, strings & organ; 1st performance : Munich, 14 August 1823.

P. 137 - Nisi Dominus, psalm (126) in G major for SATB, strings & organ; 1st performance : Munich, 14 August 1823.

P. 138 - Psalm 128 (Op.65) Wohl dem der den Ew'gen fürchtet in E major for SATB & orchestra (Leipzig: Probst) [often with Latin text: Beati omnes]

P. 139 - Ave Maria, hymn in F major for SATB & continuo.

P. 140 - Benedicat nos Deus, hymn in D minor for SATB & organ.

P. 141 - Benedicat nos Deus, hymn in C major for SATB & organ.

P. 142 - Benedicat nos Deus, hymn in B♭ major for SATB & organ.

P. 143 - Benedicat nos Deus, hymn in E minor for SATB & organ.

P. 144 - Benedicat nos Deus, hymn in F major for SATB & organ.

P. 145 - Benedicat nos Deus, hymn in E minor for SATB & organ.

P. 146 - Benedicat nos Deus, hymn in D major for SATB & organ.

P. 147 - Benedicat nos Deus, hymn in A♭ major for SATB & organ.

P. 148 - Cantilena pastoralis : Venite pastores in A major for soli (STB), orchestra & organ.

P. 149 - Litany in F minor for SATB, orchestra & organ.

P. 150 - Litany in E♭ major for SATB, orchestra & organ.

P. 151 - Litany in C major for SATB, orchestra & organ.

P. 152 - Miserere in C minor for soli (SATB), choir (SATB), orchestra & organ.

P. 153 - Miserere in C minor for SATB, strings & organ.

P. 154 - Miserere in G minor for SATB, strings & organ.

P. 155 - Miserere in F major for SATB, strings & organ.

P. 156 - Regina angelorum, antiphon in B♭ major for SATB, orchestra & organ.

P. 157 - Salve regina in E-flat major, antiphon for SATB & organ.

P. 158 - Sub tuum praesidium, litany in F minor for SATB, orchestra & organ.

P. 159 - Sub tuum praesidium, litany in B♭ major for SATB, orchestra & organ.

P. 160 - Tantum ergo, hymn in D major for soli (ST), choir (SATB), orchestra & organ.

P. 161 - Veni Sancte Spiritus, sequence in D major for SATB, orchestra & organ.

P. 162 - Veni sancte spiritus, sequence in E♭ major for SATB, orchestra & organ.

P. 163—217 - Secular Vocal Works

P. 163 - Das Freudenfest, cantata for soli (SATB), choir (SATB) & orchestra; 1st performance : Leipzig 7 October 1804.

P. 164 - Die Tonkunst trau'rt, cantata for choir (SATB) & piano.

P. 165 - Ode an die Freude, cantata for soprano solo, choir (SATB) & piano.

P. 166 - Am stillen Pfad der Kindheit, cantata for soprano solo, choir (SATB) & piano.

P. 167 - Komm! Bereue deine Schwachheit, song for soprano & piano.

P. 168 - Wohl dem Menschen, dem das Blut, song for soprano & piano.

P. 169 - Eifersucht, der Liebe Hölle, song for soprano & piano.

P. 170 - 6 Italian Canzonette, Op. 13 (Munich 1802), for soprano & piano.

No. 1 in D minor. Da gran tempo i mali miei

No. 2 in D major. Fra tutte le pene

No. 3 in B♭ major. Che fa il mio bene

No. 4 in G major. Che chiedi, che brami

No. 5 in E major. Ahi sol chi amor provo

No. 6 in E minor. Vuoi per sempre

P. 171 - 6 German Lieder, Op. 14 (Munich 1804), for soprano & piano.

No. 1 in C minor. Lebe wohl, o du der Besten

No. 2 in C major. Ach, was ist die Liebe

No. 3 in E♭ major. Kennst du das Land

No. 4 in A minor. Nur wer die Sehnsucht kennt

No. 5 in F major. Du, der ewig um mich trauert

No. 6 in G major. Hörst du, wie die Fiedel klingt

P. 172 - 6 German Lieder, Op. 15 (Leipzig 1803), for soprano & piano.

No. 1 in F major. Selig, wer der Lieb' im Arm

No. 2 in E♭ major. Ich liebe dich so inniglich

No. 3 in B♭ major. In des Lebens Maientagen

No. 4 in E major. O weine nicht!

No. 5 in A♭ major. Ob unsre Herzen gleich empfinden

No. 6 in E minor. Irr' am Bach ich unter Weiden

P. 173 - Sicchè t'inganni o Clori, arietta con variazioni in B♭ major for voice & piano.

P. 174 - 6 German Songs, Op. 19 (Munich 1805), for voice & piano.

No. 1 in F major. Holde Schönheit, deinem Rechte

No. 2 in E major. Trocknet nicht, Tränen der ewigen Liebe

No. 3 in D major. Durch stürmende Fluten

No. 4 in E♭ major. Oft am Rande stiller Fluten

No. 5 in C minor. Wann erwacht der Knabe wieder

No. 6 in G minor. Tief unten im einsamen Tale

P. 175 - Io d'amore o Dio mi moro, Italian song in E♭ major for voice & piano.

P. 176 - Le beau Fernand, prisonier d'un roi, French romance in F major for voice & piano.

P. 177 - Schäfers Klagelied : Da droben auf jenem Berge, German song in E major for voice & piano. [also with French text Vous, qui loin d'une amante]

P. 178 - Meine Ruh' ist dahin, song in C major for soprano & piano.

P. 179 - 8 Volkslieder (text by Christian Friedrich Daniel Schubart) (Leipzig, 1809), for voice & piano.

No. 1 in F major. Mein Engel den ich vom Himmel erbat

No. 2 in G major. Winterlied eines schwäbischen Bauernjungen : Mädel 's ist Winter

No. 3 in B♭ major. Ehlicher Gutermorgen : Guten Morgen groß' und kleine Sorgen

No. 4 in E♭ major. Ehliche Gutenacht : Gute Nacht unser Taglauf ist vollbracht

No. 5 in G major. Schwäbisches Bauernlied : So herzig wie mein Lisel gibt's halt nichts auf der Welt

No. 6 in E♭ major. Wenn aus deinen sanftem Blicken

No. 7 in A major. Wo find' ich den Liebling der Seele

No. 8 in F major. Das Schwabenmädchen : Ich Mädchen bin aus Schwaben

P. 180 - Romance de M. de Ségur Ce que je désire et que j'aime, French romance in D major for voice & piano.

P. 181 - 6 German Lieder for voice & piano (Munich 1810)

No. 1 in G major. Ich hab' ein Mädchen

No. 2 in B♭ major. Sie fliehet fort

No. 3 in F major. Soviel ich mich besinnen kann

No. 4 in F major. Ich denke dein

No. 5 in G minor. Dort jenseits die Bergen

No. 6 in D minor. Dir nah, o die ich liebe

P. 182 - 6 French Romances for voice & piano (Bonn, 1812/13)

No. 1 in C minor. Rien, tendre amour, ne résiste à tes armes

No. 2 in C major. Dérobe ta lumière, ô lune trop brillante

No. 3 in F major. Je vais revoir la beauté que j'adore

No. 4 in G minor. Rosier jadis charmant

No. 5 in G major. Lisis avait de la jeunesse

No. 6 in F major. Que j'aime à voir les hirondelles

P. 183 - 6 German Songs for voice & piano (Leipzig, 1813)

No. 1 in F major. Aus des Tales düster'n Auen

No. 2 in E minor. Traurig sah ich euch verblühen (= P.188/2, Op. 70 No. 2)

No. 3 in F major. Dein gedenk' ich'

No. 4 in C minor. Lebenslang, ja lebenslang störst du, Geliebte (= P.188/6, Op. 70 No. 6)

No. 5 in C minor. Es ist so angenhem, so süß

No. 6 in E major. Wohl ist des Lebens Bahn

P. 184 - 12 Italian Canzonette, Op. 40 (Munich 1813), for voice & piano.

No. 1 in E minor. Che ciascun per te sospiri

No. 2 in F minor. Mi lagnero tacendo

No. 3 in B♭ major. Chi mai di questo core

No. 4 in G major. Bella fiamma del mio core

No. 5 in E minor. Bei labbri che amore

No. 6 in C major. Torna in quell'onda chiare sola

No. 7 in F major. Chi un dolce amor condanna

No. 8 in E♭ major. Per pietà, bell'idol mio

No. 9 in F major. Conservati fedele

No. 10 in A minor. Se mai turbo il tuo riposo

No. 11 in A major. Ch'io mai vi possa

No. 12 in E minor. Dal tuo gentil sembiante

P. 185 - [6] Ballads and Romances, Op. 46 (Leipzig 1814), for voice & piano.

No. 1 in B♭ major. Ich sah einst, im Hain eine liebe Gestalt

No. 2 in F major. Ich sehnt' als flinkes Mädchen

No. 3 in G minor. An der Quelle saß der Knabe

No. 4 in E major. In der Väter Hallen ruhte Ritter Rudolfs Heldenarm

No. 5 in C minor. Es stand der Sänger mit trübem Sinn (= P.188/4, Op. 70 No. 4)

No. 6 in B♭ major. Ich danke seinem Mut mein Leben

P. 186 - 3 Canzonette con variazioni, Op. 65 (Offenbach 1823), for voice & piano.

No. 1 in A♭ major. Deh ascolta amata Clori

No. 2 in B♭ major. Sol puo dir come

No. 3 in A major. Mi sento struggere sospiro

P. 187 - 6 German Lieder, Op. 69 (Leipzig 1823), for voice & piano.

No. 1 in A♭ major. O, der kindlich schönen Tage meiner Liebe

No. 2 in A♭ major. O Geliebte, dein vergessen

No. 3 in B♭ major. Purpurfarbig am Hügel Gasar schlummert ein König

No. 4 in E minor. Das Jahr ist nun vorüber

No. 5 in E major. Was soll ich in der Fremde tun?

No. 6 in A major. Verklärtes Bild aus meiner Urzeit

P. 188 - 6 German Lieder, Op. 70 (Leipzig 1824), for voice & piano.

No. 1 in C major. Leise, leise, kleine Laute

No. 2 in E minor. Traurig sah ich euch verblühen (= P.183/2)

No. 3 in B♭ major. Auf dem wilden Meer des Lebens

No. 4 in C minor. Es stand der Sänger mit trübem Sinn (= P.185/5, Op. 46 No. 5)

No. 5 in A major. Hast du in meinem Auge nicht gelesen

No. 6 in C minor. Lebenslang, ja lebenslang störst du, Geliebte (= P.183/4)

P. 189 - Die Nachtigall : O kömmt' ich doch die Nachtigall, German Lied in F major, for voice & piano.

P. 190 - 6 Duets, Op. 39 (Offenbach 1818), for soprano, voice (alto?) & piano with Italian and German texts.

No. 1 in B♭ major. Ombre amene amiche piante / Holde Ruhe, o kehre wieder

No. 2 in D major. Mi giuri che m'ami / Viel gibt es der Schmerzen

No. 3 in E♭ major. Vaghe sponde amiche arene / Öffne dich der Freude wieder

No. 4 in G minor. Son lungi e non mi brami / Singt oft beim Mondenscheine

No. 5 in C major. Felice età dell'oro / Seid ewig ihr entschwunden

No. 6 in A major. Mi sento struggere sospiro e peno / Du meines Herzens einzige Wonne

P. 191 - 12 Songs for SSB and STB with piano; Op. 16: vol. 1 (Leipzig 1803), for SSB (6 pieces) with German and Italian texts.

No. 1 in F major. Lieblich leuchten mir zwei Sterne / Vi conosco amate stelle

No. 2 in G major. An ein Brautpaar : O welche süße Tränen / O che felici pianti che amabili martir

No. 3 in C major. Nein niemand wird mich sehen / No non vedrete mai

No. 4 in A major. Ich hoffe ich kam nicht / Ch'io speri ma come

No. 5 in B♭ major. Die Liebe die ich fühle / Mai l'amor mio verace

No. 6 in E♭ major. Zu blöde es zu wagen / Da quel sembiante appresi

P. 192 - 12 Songs for SSB and STB with piano; Op. 16: vol. 2 (Leipzig 1803) for STB (6 pieces) with German and Italian texts.

No. 1 in A major. Liebende trauet nicht / Più non si trovano

No. 2 in E♭ major. Ihr beneidenswerten Hirten / Quanto mai felici siete

No. 3 in B♭ major. Vor Freude fast trunken / Fra un dolce deliro

No. 4 in G major. Ewig nur dich zu lieben / Sempre sarò costante

No. 5 in C major. Sei taub bei meiner Klage / Si soffre una tiranna

No. 6 in F major. Dich zu sehn ist Augenweide / So non so se amor tu sei

P. 193 - 8 German Lieder, Op. 17 (Leipzig 1803), for SSTB & piano.

No. 1 in B♭ major. Wer ist ein freier Mann

No. 2 in F major. Der Bund : Lieb' und Schweigen ist der Bund

No. 3 in B♭ major. Wie schön ist's im Freien

No. 4 in A major. Beruf zur Liebe : Unser süssester Beruf

No. 5 in G major. Der Frühling : Des Winters Hülle deckte nicht

No. 6 in E♭ major. O selig wer sein Leben

No. 7 in C major. Grabe wenn's behagt

No. 8 in B♭ major. Mütterliche Warnung : Selbst die glücklichste der Ehen

P. 194 - S'io t'amo, o Dio, Notturno a 4 voci in E flat major for SSTB & piano.

P. 195 - È pena troppo barbara, canon in E minor for 3 voices & piano. Alternative German text : Es ist zuviel Pein

P. 196 - Ach ein Blick von der Geliebten, canon in G major for 3 voices & piano.

P. 197 - 6 Songs (Bonn 1821), for SSTB & piano with German and Italian texts.

No. 1 in B♭ major. Nur Toren schätzen das Glück der Liebe / Del sen gl'ardori

No. 2 in G major. In Liebesarmen wähnt man sich glücklich / Se un core annodi

No. 3 in E minor. Liebe läßt sich nicht verhehlen / So che presto ogn'un s'avvede

No. 4 in F major. Sieh Mädchen was lebet / Se intende, si poco

No. 5 in A♭ major. Der nur weiß wie Untreu schmerzt / Sol puo dir come si trova

No. 6 in E major. Sind des Liebesgottes Bande / Se per tutti ordisce amore

P. 198 - Es lebe Lieb', es lebe Wein, canon in F major for 3 voices & piano.

P. 199 - 3 Soldatenlieder, Op. 58 (Offenbach 1823), for TTBB & piano.

No. 1 in D major. Feldjägerlied : Mit Hörnerschall und Lustgesang

No. 2 in E major. Soldatentreue : Mädchen mit dem grünen Kranze

No. 3 in D major. Husarenlied : Husaren sind gar tapfre Krieger

P. 200 - Gesänge der Hellenen (text by Christian Bork), Op. 72 (Leipzig 1825) for TTBB & piano.

No. 1 in E{{flat} major. Schwertlied : Was ist das Schwert ?

No. 2 in A{{flat} major. Abschied vom Liebchen : Lieb' Liebchen wisch die Tränen ab

No. 3 in D major. Vor der Schlacht bei Anapoli : Auf ihr Brüder, stoßt ins Horn

No. 4 in E major. Nach der Schlacht bei Anapoli : Schlachtfeld sei mir froh willkommen

No. 5 in E minor. Der Geist der Vorzeit : Was glüht in des jungen Griechen Brust

No. 6 in D minor. Diamanty : Was blickst du hinüber ins Morgenrot

P. 201 - 6 German Songs, Op. 74 (Leipzig 1825) for SSTB & piano.

No. 1 in E♭ major. Liebe beseligt das Leben

No. 2 in B♭ major. Welch unbekannte Macht

No. 3 in E♭ major. Wie der Tag mir schleichet

No. 4 in C major. Was ist's das mir das Herz in deiner Näh' bewegt

No. 5 in B♭ major. Junges Herz voll Zärtlichkeit

No. 6 in A♭ major. Gefilde des Todes Gefilde der Ruh'

P. 202 - O lieber kleiner Fischer Fidelin, barcarole in G major for SSTB & piano.

P. 203 - Ch'io ti lascia...Mi lagnerò tacendo, rectitative and aria for B solo & orchestra (from 'Siroe' by Metastasio)

P. 204 - Figlia s'è ver che m'ami...Leon piagato a morte, recitative and aria for B solo & orchestra (from 'Adriano in Siria' by Metastasio)

P. 205 - In questa tomba oscura, arietta in C♯ minor, for voice & piano.

P. 206 - Nicht meine Tage, aria in E major for soprano or tenor & orchestra.

P. 207 - Dunque mi lascia...Ritorna fedele, recitative and aria for S solo & orchestra (alternative German text : So stirbt die Hoffnung...O nah dich dem Herzen)

P. 208 - Ah, che in certezza...S'ora fatal s'appressa, recitative and aria for T solo & orchestra.

P. 209 - Si Riccardo verrà...Lasciatemi un momento affanni del mio cor, recitative and aria for S solo & orchestra.

P. 210 - Frei von Qual und bangem Leiden, aria for S solo & orchestra for Wranitzky's Oberon König der Elfen.

P. 211 - [22] Solfeggi for bass (on the text : Amen)

P. 212 - [21] Singeübungen, Op. 24 (Leipzig 1804) for S solo & piano. First part consists of 18 exercises without text, second part features 3 exercises with Italian text.

P. 213 - [18] Singeübungen, Op. 32 (Leipzig 1806) for B solo & piano.

P. 214 - [18] Singeübungen for T solo & piano.

P. 215 - [18] Singeübungen, Op. 50 (Berlin 1819), for S solo & piano.

P. 216 - [20] Singeübungen for B solo & piano.

P. 217 - [20] Singeübungen, Op. 63 (Berlin 1822), for A solo & piano.

P. 235 - Bassoon Concerto in F major

P. 236 - Bassoon Concerto in F major

P. 237 - Bassoon Concerto in F major.Bassoon Concerto in F major; 1st performance : Munich, 14 December 1812.

P. 238 - Bassoon Concerto in G minor

P. 239 - Horn Concerto in E major

P. 240 - Horn Concerto in F major

P. 241 - Cello Concerto No. 1 in A major (Zurich 1803). The 3rd movement features variations on Mozart's Là ci darem la mano.

P. 242 - Cello Concerto No. 2 in B♭ major (Zurich 1803).

P. 243 - Cello Concerto in E minor

P. 244 - Cello Concertino in D major, Op.46 (Leipzig, 1813)

P. 248 - Potpourri for violin & orchestra in B♭ major, Op. 61 (Offenbach 1823)

P. 249 - 3 Duos for viola & cello, Op. 8 (C major, E♭ major, C minor) (Zurich 1801)

P. 250 - 3 Duos for viola & cello, Op. 9 (D major, G minor, F major) (Munich 1802)

P. 251 - 6 Cello Sonatas, Op. 1 (A major, C major, D minor, G major, B♭ major, F minor) (Zurich 1803)

P. 253 - 24 small duets for cellos on themes by Mozart (Zurich 1805)

P. 254 - Sonatina in E minor for piano & flute (or violin), Op. 34 (Munich 1809)

P. 255 - Horn Sonata in E minor (also for cello), Op.44 (Leipzig 1813)

P. 256 - Sonata in B♭ major for piano & clarinet (Bonn 1819)

P. 257 - Sonatina in D major for piano & flute (Munich 1818)

P. 258 - Sonata in F major for piano & basset horn (or cello), Op. 62 (Offenbach 1823)

P. 260 - Piano trio in E♭ major

P. 261 - 3 Sonatas for piano, violin & cello, Op. 1 (B♭ major, C major, A major) (Paris 1793)

P. 262 - Sonata for 2 pianos & violin in D major, Op. 42 (Offenbach 1814)

P. 263 - 3 Trios for flute, violin & cello, Op. 71 (G major, E minor, D major) (Offenbach 1824)

P. 265 - 3 String Quartets, Op. 6 (C major, B♭ major, G minor) (Munich 1801)

P. 269 - Quartet in D minor for piano, violin, viola & cello, Op. 40 (Leipzig 1810)

P. 271 - 3 Quartets for bassoon, violin, viola & cello, Op. 40 (C major, D minor, B♭ major) (Offenbach 1814)

P. 281 - 3 Wind Quintets, Op. 67 (G major, E minor, E♭ major) (Offenbach 1824)

P. 282 - 3 Wind Quintets, Op. 68 (A major, F major, D minor) (Offenbach 1824)

Arranged as Sextet for oboe (or violin), 2 violas, 2 horns & cello, Op. 10 (Munich 1802)

P. 284 - Sextet in E major for 2 violins, 2 horns, viola & cello, Op. 15 (Munich 1803)

P. 285 - 3 Piano pieces (A major, E♭ major, E♭ major) (Mannheim 1784)

P. 286 - Piano Sonata in F major, Op. 3 (Munich 1800). The Andante of this Sonata is by his wife Margarethe.

P. 287 - Piano Sonata in D minor, Op. 12 (Munich 1802)

P. 289 - 6 Waltzes for piano (D major, G minor, G major, C major, D major, F major) (Munich 1807)

P. 290 - 6 Waltzes for piano (C major, B♭ major, E♭ major, G minor, E♭ major, G major) (Munich 1807)

P. 291 - 6 easy pieces for piano, Op. 73 (D major, G minor, E minor, C major, E♭ major, F major) (Leipzig 1825)

P. 292 - Sonata in E♭ major for piano 4 hands (Paris 1795/1796)

P. 293 - Sonata in C major for piano 4 hands, Op. 2 (Munich 1799)

P. 294 - 3 pièces détachées for piano 4 hands, Op. 11 (F major, D minor, E major) (Munich 1802)

P. 295 - Sonata in B♭ major for piano 4 hands, Op. 9 (Leipzig 1806)

P. 296 - Potpourri in D minor for piano 4 hands (Munich 1807)

P. 297—310 - Arrangements

P. 297 - Mass of St Edmund in B♭ major (London 1870). Not authentic. Kyrie and Gloria are arrangements of P. 57.

P. 298 - O salutaris hostia, hymn in C major for S solo & organ. Arrangement of P. 120 by Etienne-Alexandre Choron (1771-1834).

P. 299 - Kantate zum Friedenfest for soli (SATB), choir (SATB) & orchestra. 1st & 3rd movements are identical to P. 163. Rest by Johann Gottfried Schade.

P. 300 - Kantate zum Kurfeier for choir (SATB) & orchestra; 1st performance : Stuttgart, 9 May 1803. According to Pechstaedt, an earlier version of 'Freudenfest', P. 163.

P. 301 - Harpsichord concerto in C major. Not authentic. Theme of 3rd movement taken from P. 5.

P. 302 - Harpsichord concerto in D major. Probably authentic. 3rd movement later arranged for piano quintet P. 279.

P. 303 - Andante for harpsichord & orchestra in D minor. Authentic. Later arranged as the 2nd movement of piano quintet P. 279.

P. 304 - Trio in F major for violin, horn & bassoon, Op. 23 (Munich 1828). Movements 1, 2, 5 & 6 are spurious arrangements of P. 282 No. 2.

P. 305 - Oboe quartet. More like a spurious collection of 7 pieces for oboe, violin, viola & cello (E♭, F, d, C, G, a, F). Pieces 2 & 7 = pieces 2 & 5 of P. 270.

P. 306 - Allegretto in G major for wind octet. Arrangement of a duet for Don Gusmann and Bastian in P. 6 by Wilhelm Legrand (1769-1845).

P. 307 - 4 Variations in B♭ major for flute & piano on Danzi's arietta Sicchè t'inganni o Clori P. 173. By Josef Nicola Kovacic.

P. 308 - 5 Melodies for flute found in 'Recueil d'Ariettes et Romances' (Mainz c. 1812). Not authentic.

P. 309 - Arrangement of Mozart's Die Zauberflöte for string quartet (Munich 1797). Authentic.

P. 310 - Arrangement of Mozart's Symphony in G minor (KV 183 or 550?) by Danzi, mentionned in Louis Spohr's autobiography. Lost.

P. 311—346 - Works of uncertain authorship

P. 311 - 3 Fragments for an unknown opera (intrumental piece, duet for ST, aria for S).

P. 312 - La destra ti chiedo, duetto for ST & orchestra (text from Metastasio's 'Demofoonte')

P. 313 - Ruhig schlug hier im Busen, recitative and aria for Paul Wranitzky's opera Oberon, König der Elfen. 1st performance : 6 April 1811. Destroyed in 1942.

P. 314 - Die Blumenfee, prologue; 1st performance : Karlsruhe 29 September 1812. Lost.

P. 315 - March for Kotzebue's play Ubaldo. Mentioned in Danzi's letter to Joseph von Morigotti dated 24 June 1813. Lost.

P. 316 - Bard Chorus for the play Hermann by an unknown author. Mentioned in Danzi's letter to Joseph von Morigotti dated 14 August 1814. Lost.

P. 317 - Der Schiffskapitän oder Die Unbefangenen, vaudeville in 1 act; 1st performance : Berlin 8 June 1817. Lost.

P. 318 - 2 Entr'actes. No. 4 and 5 of a collection of 25 entr'actes by various composers.

P. 319 - Instrumental pieces & chorus for a cantata celebrating the wedding of Margrave Leopold von Baden and Princess Sophie on 25 July 1819. Lost.

P. 320 - 5 Entr'actes for Grillparzer's play Sappho (1819). Lost.

P. 321 - 13 Entr'actes. Destroyed in 1942.

P. 322 - Vater nur dir zu dienen, middle section of a cantata by J.A. Seitz in C major for SATB & orchestra.

P. 323 - Vater unser, hymn in F major for STTB & piano. (Piano part in G major, 1 T part in C major, other voices in F major).

P. 324 - Offertory in F major for soli (SB), orchestra & organ. Lost. Referenced in a catalogue without text.

P. 325 - Tantum ergo, hymn in C major. Lost. Only trombone I part extant.

P. 326 - Tantum ergo, hymn in C major. Lost. Only trombone I part extant.

P. 327 - Cantata for the inauguration of the new building of the Karlsruhe 'Museumsgesellschaft'. Performed on 9 December 1814. Lost.

P. 328 - Cantata for the celebration of Grand Duke Karl Friedrich von Baden's birthday. Performed on 9 February 1823. Lost.

P. 329 - 6 Italian Canzonette for tenor & piano.

No. 1 in C major. Senza l'amabile Dio di l'itera

No. 2 in F major. Ah che il destino, mio bel tesoro

No. 3 in F minor. Mi lagnero tacendo (arrangement of P. 184/2)

No. 4 in E minor. Che ciascun per te sospiri (arrangement of P. 184/1)

No. 5 in B♭ major. Ogni piacer mi spiace se grato

No. 6 in E♭ major. Io d'amore o Dio mi moro (arrangement of P. 175)

P. 330 - 6 Songs for piano, Op. 63. (Songs for voice & piano, or purely piano pieces?). Lost.

P. 331 - 5 Canons for SATB. All are unfinished and without text. From Louis Spohr's autograph with the note '...Franz Danzi 25 Juny 1816.'

P. 332 - Ah, perfido spergiuro...Per pietà, recitative and aria for soprano & orchestra. Performed at the Leipzig Gewandhaus : 3 Nov. 1796, 29 Apr. 1798, 28 Nov. 1799 & 10 Oct. 1802. Lost. (Identical to Beethoven's Op. 65 composed in 1796 ?)

P. 333 - Symphony in D major. Destroyed in 1942.

P. 334 - Symphony in C minor. Destroyed in 1942. Most likely identical to P. 219.

P. 335 - Sinfonia concertante for 2 bassoons. Mentioned in Danzi's letter to Joseph von Morigotti dated 23 March 1809. Performed in Stuttgart 1809, Munich 1812 and Berlin 1824. Lost.

P. 336 - Sinfonia concertante for 2 horns. Mentioned in a concert program dated 19 May 1818, Königsberg. Lost.

P. 337 - Sinfonia concertante for 2 clarinets. Mentioned in a report of a performance in Vienna 1821. Lost.

P. 338 - Piano Concerto in C major. Mentioned in Danzi's letter to Joseph von Morigotti dated 18 April 1808. Maybe identical to P. 301. Lost.

P. 339 - Oboe Concerto. Mentioned in a concert program dated March 1818, Stockholm. Lost.

P. 340 - Cello Concerto in D major. Labeled 'Nr. 1' in the 1822 catalogue of publisher Nageli (Zurich). Supposedly published in 1809. Lost.

P. 341 - Cello Concerto in C major. Labeled 'Nr. 2' in the 1822 catalogue of publisher Nageli (Zurich). Supposedly published in 1809. Lost.

P. 342 - Fantasia for oboe. Mentioned in a concert program dated August 1822, Strasburg. Lost.

P. 343 - 6 Montferrines for piano. Doutful authorship.

P. 344 - 'Marche des Chevaliers de l'Ordre des Séraphims en Suède' in D major for piano (Georg Joseph Vogler)

P. 345 - Variations (8) for piano in G major (Carl August Cannabich or Christian Cannabich)

P. 346 - Sonata for piano 4 hands, Op. 11. Only mentioned in catalogues. Most likely identical to 'Pièces détachées' P. 294.
